settings:
type can be 'alpha' or 'indev'. When using alpha, seed can be -9223372036854775808 to 9223372036854775807 (int64) and determines the surrounding terrian
-->
valid types: none - for all of level - 'indev' output only - falls back to top for 'alpha' output top - uses the top 'levels' levels keeping only 'airtokeep' levels of air range - outputs 'levels' levels, starting at 'toplevel' and going down. Unfortunately, toplevel doesn't really have a relation to the levels shown in DF due to variable hell location (usually at a negative level in DF). smart - for smart dropping of levels, keeps 'airtokeep' levels of air and outputs 'levels' levels from 'interesting' levels in the area (levels that have floor, tall staircases are collapsed) starting at the top (highest ground level) and going down. For all output in alpha, you are limited to 127 minecraft layers, or 127/squaresize Dwarf Fortress levels (42 for the default 3x3x3)
0 means to detect (it will be snowy if there are any ice walls or floors 1 means force to snowy -1 means force to not snowy
if set to 1, modifies wall shape to take into account diagonal passages but takes longer to process conversion changes sand and gravel above a airspace to the specified material type (3 is dirt), 0 is off

buildings:
Torches are a special building, as they don't exist in Dwarf Fortress. They are added randomly to dark, inside or subterrainean areas that don't have spatter (mostly to keep them out of natural caves.) See the notes below on directionality (the numbers).
Buildings - buildings can have direction they face appended to the name, similar to ramps. This is mainly intended for the single tile buildings like chest, doors and chairs. If you set a 'face' parameter to be a building, the number will indicate the direction of the surrounding directions that have that building (the same way that ramps indicate direction). If no surrounding buildings are found (or no 'face' is set), walls are searched for, and their direction is indicated with a negative number (so you may want a chair to face tables but face away from walls if no tables are near). If you want to use direction and position, direction comes after position.
